statement.tex: \text{Find the modulus and argument of}\\ \text{the complex number }\dfrac{1+2\iota}{1-3\iota}

reason.tex: \vert z\vert\text{ is correct. But }arg(z)\text{ is not.}\\ \text{Here is why. }\\ \text{In }z = -\frac{1}{2} + \frac{\iota}{2} = \vert z\vert\cdot(\cos\theta + \iota\sin\theta), \\ \begin{align} -\frac{1}{2} &= \vert z\vert \cos\theta \implies \cos\theta = -\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \\ \frac{1}{2} &= \vert z\vert\sin\theta\implies \sin\theta = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \end{align} \\ \text{So, we are looking for a }\theta\text{ whose }\\ \cos\theta\lt 0\text{ and }\sin\theta\gt 0 \implies\text{ second quadrant.}\\ \text{And given that }\tan\theta = -1, \theta = \frac{3\pi}{4}.
